subject: Re: Anyone use JUnit with Ant and Apache Digester?
msgSnippet: loadFile is a String holding the name of the XML file to be parsed by Digester.  My Ant script copies it into the classes folder. MyClass has its own main()
messageBody:
"loadFile" is a String holding the name of the XML file to be parsed
by Digester. My Ant script copies it into the classes folder.

MyClass has its own main() method. When I invoke MyClass via a call
from the command line (embedded in a Windows bat file), MyClass find
the file just fine. When MyClass is invoked by TestMyClass (running
under JUnit), it cannot find the XML file.

In my searches of this group archive and the Web, I have seen
references to JUnit's custom ClassLoader and how it has trouble
finding files in the classpath, but no solutions/workarounds.

I guess for now I can try reading files via streams from File objects
instead of using getResource() or getResourceAsStream().

Paolo

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, jc <john.cavacas@g...> wrote:
> What is the value of "loadFile"? Is "loadFile" in your classpath?
>
> jc
>

> >
> >
> > So far I have tried the following variations:
> >
> >
Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader().getResourceAsStream(loadFile);
> >
> > TestMyJUnitTest.class.getResourceAsStream(loadFile);
> >
> > this.getClass().getResourceAsStream(loadFile);
> >
> > MyClass.class.getResourceAsStream(loadFile);
> >
> > getClass().getClassLoader().getResourceAsStream(loadFile);
> >
> > None of these produce a non-null InputStream object for the Digester
> > to work with. I have verified that Ant properly copies all the XML
> > files I want Digester to parse into my classes.ant tree.
> >
